sentence.Network_en: The eight chromosomes were randomly distributed at metaphase I.
sentence.Network_cn: 在中期Ⅰ8对染色体的分布是无秩序的.

entry.def: A random sample or method is one in which all the people or things involved have an equal chance of being chosen.

example.ex: The survey used a random sample of two thousand people across England and Wales...
example.tran: 该调查在英格兰和威尔士随机抽样了2,000人。

example.ex: The competitors will be subject to random drug testing.
example.tran: 参赛者将要接受随机药检。

entry.def: If you describe events as random, you mean that they do not seem to follow a definite plan or pattern.

example.tran: 加诸无辜受害者的无端暴行

example.ex: Children's words and actions are often fairly random.
example.tran: 小孩子的言行常常是随性而为。

entry.def: If you choose people or things at random, you do not use any particular method, so they all have an equal chance of being chosen.

example.ex: We received several answers, and we picked one at random.
example.tran: 我们收到了一些答复，并从中随机挑选了一个。

entry.def: If something happens at random, it happens without a definite plan or pattern.

example.ex: Three black people were killed by shots fired at random from a minibus.
example.tran: 3名黑人被从一辆面包车里胡乱射出的子弹打死了。

sentences.sentence: "bullets were fired into the crowd at random"

auth_sentence.content: Variations happen randomly and individuals do what they do.

auth_sentence.content: Our major cities are scattered randomly around the world.

Sentence.sentence: Several recent studies have found that being randomly (随机地) assigned to a roommate of another race can lead to increased tolerance but also to a greater likelihood (可能性)of conflict.
According to two recent studies, randomly assigned roommates of different races are more likely to experience conflicts so strained that one roommate will move out
Assigning students' lodging randomly is not a good policy.
That same study found that randomly assigned interracial roommates at Ohio State broke up before the end of the quarter about twice as often as same-race roommates.
Fazio's Indiana study found that three times as many randomly assigned interracial roommates were no longer living together at the end of the semester, compared with white roommates
What did the study find about randomly assigned interracial roommates at Ohio State University?
